Watching traffic while operating the PC Printer Option card is complex.

Power on with printer option attached:

0x121 0x00 0x00 0x25
0x121 0x00 0x01 0x10
0x121 0x00 0x09 0x00 0x00 0x00
0x121 0x00 0x0d 0x00 0x12 0x00
0x121 0x00 0x06 0x00 0x80 0x00 0x00 0x00

0x121 0x00 0x09 0x00 0x00 0x00
0x121 0x00 0x05 0x00 0x8c 0x00
0x121 0x00 0x0d 0x00 0x07 0x00
0x121 0x00 0x06 0x00 0x80 0x00 0x00 0x00
0x121 0x00 0x0e 0x00 0xe7 0x00
0x121 0x00 0x0b 0x00
0x121 0x00 0x0b 0x00

The 0x140 and 0x110 appear to be involved with token passing between
the function board and the pc printer option. The 0x140 is always
associated with BRQ going low, perhaps the option card requesting the
bus, and perhaps 0x110 is handing the token back, or maybe even the
opposite.

0x124 and 0x141 commands look like normal 0x121 commands as far as
coding. However both versions are sent. This might be because one of
them is for effect and the other is to keep the function board in the
loop regarding the position of the carriage.  All the 0x141 codes look
familiar except for 0x141 0x83 with a consistent return value of 0x01.

0x114 commands are not familiar looking, except that the 0x03 command
seem to come approximately in pairs with the second version turning on
the high bit in arg1.

Okay, here's the current theory:

  the option card pulls BRQ low
  function card sends 0x140
  option card releases BRQ (pulled back high)
  option card returns 0x00
  option card sends some commands on the bus
  when finished, option card sends 0x110 to release the bus

In order to really determine the direction of these I need some kind
of circuit to tell which direction the pull downs are coming
from.

Pulling BRQ low manually, I get a gigantic stream of continuous
alternating 0x140's and 0x110's, which is consistent with my theory.
